description: Standard operating procedure for installing drywall sheets in residential and commercial construction

steps.action: Measure wall dimensions with tape measure and mark cutting lines
steps.safety_notes: Ensure accurate measurements to minimize waste

steps.action: Cut drywall sheet to required dimensions using utility knife and t-square
steps.safety_notes: Keep fingers away from blade, use sharp blade to prevent slipping

steps.action: Position drywall sheet against wall studs and check alignment with level
steps.safety_notes: Use proper lifting technique, get assistance for large sheets

steps.action: Secure drywall to studs using drill and drywall screws every 12 inches
steps.safety_notes: Drive screws just below surface without breaking paper

steps.action: Apply joint tape over seams between drywall sheets
steps.safety_notes: Ensure tape adheres properly with no bubbles

steps.action: Apply first coat of joint compound over tape and fasteners
steps.safety_notes: Wear dust mask, ensure proper ventilation

steps.action: Sand joint compound smooth after drying using sanding block
steps.safety_notes: Wear dust mask and safety glasses, ensure proper ventilation

common_hazards: Electrical hazard from cutting into wires
inspection_points: Clean cuts with no damaged edges
